page.title: Viet Cong and PAVN strategy, organization and structure

rev.comment: /* Early effectiveness of the Viet Cong */ She didn't sink. She settled on the bottom pierside, fixed, and towed to Subic Bay.
rev.diff:
Line 32: Line 32:
===Early effectiveness of the Viet Cong===
===Early effectiveness of the Viet Cong===
â
[[Image:USS Card (CVE-11).jpg|200px|thumb|right|By 1964, the VC were attacking in regimental strength with growing success. A VC demolition team even sunk a US ship, the [[USS Card]].<ref>Davidson, Vietnam at War, p. 316</ref>]]
+
[[Image:USS Card (CVE-11).jpg|200px|thumb|right|By 1964, the VC were attacking in regimental strength with growing success. A VC demolition team even damaged [[USS Card]] while pierside.<ref>Davidson, Vietnam at War, p. 316</ref>]]
By 1964 the VC, supported by smaller numbers of NVA, were increasingly effective, conducting attacks in regimental strength. The [[Battle of BÃ¬nh GiÃ£|Battle of Binh Gia]] where the victorious VC held the battlefield for 4 days rather than simply melt away as in earlier times is a vivid example of their confidence and effectiveness. Their operations regularly drubbed Diem's troops, and although Diem's forces controlled a number of urban areas and scattered garrisons, the security situation had become critical.
